bug.author: umgupta
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.9 Python version: 3.7 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I was trying to pull an experiment by ID and project. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
I ran wandb pull <ID> -p <project_name> and this happend. <denchmark-code>Error: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable </denchmark-code>
I went ahead and further looked into the code... it seems that the error is in apis/internal.py, line 905. It seems the gql result is {model: None} which cause the problem while querying bucket key etc.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.95. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Please set your "entity" with the -e argument. if you do that you will find that the command will work. You are correct that the error message is not helpful and should be improved.
I am sorry but what is entity? I am not sure what it means so I left empty.

Oh! nevermind. I found it here: <denchmark-link:https://docs.wandb.com/wandb/init>https://docs.wandb.com/wandb/init</denchmark-link>
If anyone stumbles on this issues... here is the relevant information. entity ‚Äî the team posting this run (default: your username or your default team) Thanks for the quick reply.
